data.title: Allow conversion of FixedMaterial to ShaderMaterial
data.body:
Allow conversion of FixedMaterial to ShaderMaterial

This should allow easier pipeline for shaders from imported assets

data.title: Exports crashing in some machines in Win64 and Mac
data.body:
In Mac I think exports aren't working for Maverick (the latest version of OSX)

In Win it usually works well except for some machines.. for example a user pasted this log:

---

Firma con problemas:
Nombre del evento de problema: APPCRASH
Nombre de la aplicación: JesusChristOurLordREBORN_win_64.exe
Versión de la aplicación: 0.0.0.0
Marca de tiempo de la aplicación: 547e241e
Nombre del módulo con errores: StackHash_0a9e
Versión del módulo con errores: 0.0.0.0
Marca de tiempo del módulo con errores: 00000000
Código de excepción: c0000005
Desplazamiento de excepción: 00000000
Versión del sistema operativo: 6.1.7601.2.1.0.256.1
Id. de configuración regional: 11274
Información adicional 1: 0a9e
Información adicional 2: 0a9e372d3b4ad19135b953a78882e789
Información adicional 3: 0a9e
Información adicional 4: 0a9e372d3b4ad19135b953a78882e789

---

I have a HP G60 dual core 2.10 GHz, 4Gb de RAM, WIN 7 x64, onboard video card
I have DirectX 10 installed (this is not important since engine uses OpenGL)

I tried x32 version
I tried compatibility mode and lowering the resolution
I tried executing as admin

data.title: VSE Bug - Vector Interpolate node doesn't allow assign to C socket
data.body:
How to reproduce:
Add Vector Interplate node
Plug vec to A and B pads they will work
Plug vec to C it wont work connection will be terminated

PS
Would be cool to have 2Vector 1Scalar Interpolate node with C socket being scalar.

data.title: VSE Bug - XForm+Vector Multiply and InvMultiply nodes doesn't work also they are swaped in Add menu
data.body:
Scene:

> Spatial
> 
> > Test Cube

What I do:
I add Input node in fragment shader
I add XForm+Vector InvMultiply (it is swaped with Multiply in Add menu but both are broken)
I connect Vertex output forn Input Node to it
I connect InvCameraMatrix output from Input Node to it

What happens:
Cube turns White

What was expected:
First it should do nothing after I connect both inputs of XF+V InvMult and when I connect its output to Emmission it should display newly produced Vector as colors on Cube.

data.title: VSE Bug - Crash on removing Graph Resource

Simple scene:

>

Add Shader Resource to Cube

Crash

data.title: VSE Bug - Unconnected RGB Op makes graph not working
data.body:
Reproduce:
Create simple scene:

> Spatial
> 
> > Test Cube + shader graph resource

In Graph:
Add RGB Op node
Add RGB Constant Node
Plug RGB Constant to Output Diffuse
Change RGB Const color

What happens:
Nothing :D

What should:
Cube should change color, duh :P

data.title: Pr-tween-call-deferred
data.body:
Add call deferred support for Tween
Bump callback arguments from 1 to 5

data.title: Just pressed and released info for Input Actions
data.body: Hey, there. So, there's no "Just Pressed" or "Released" functions for input Actions; I think they would be really useful to assist in programming in input. Interestingly, there's isEcho() for InputEvents which could help, but there's no tutorial or help on using them.

data.title: RichTextLabel gets clipped on window resize
data.body:
I've got a 2D game I'm building, and everything seems to be going well, however the windows (not sure if other platforms are affected) binary exhibits problematic behavior.

The project settings are 470x320 width, stretch mode 2d, stretch aspect keep, resizable.

One of the popups I create is a TextureFrame with a RichTextLabel positioned inside it.

Everything is fine when you start the game, or when you stretch it proportionally (e.g. 940x640).

However, there is a problem when you stretch the screen too tall or too wide (so that black bars are created e.g. 1280 x 640).

When this happens, the RichTextLabel is clipped proportionate to the extra black bar space. The wider you make it, the more clipping on the left/right. The taller you make it, the more clipping top/bottom.

Is there something I've missed in terms of settings, or is this a bug with the engine?

I have confirmed that the problem exists on Android and Windows.

data.title: YSort node invert function and customizeable axis
data.body:
Hey, there. So, I think the YSort node could be reworked a bit.

1) Invert function. The ability to invert the effect (for placing objects further up on the Y axis on top of others) would be really useful for platforming views.

2) Customizeable variable. I think it might be nice to rework "Y-Sort" into just a "Sort" node, allowing you to sort the collection of children node based on whatever you need (for example, sorting by a custom variable, or even a custom function).

data.title: If a project is ran and main_scene is not set, show a pop up with a dropdown list that lets them change the main scene
data.body:
I don't think it's a good experience to have to open up the project settings dialog, find the main_scene variable and set the scene file just to run the project the first time. It's especially not friendly to new users who just want to see something running.

For the convenience of the user, if main_scene is not set, the editor should show a pop up asking the user to select the project's main scene from a drop down list of every scene that exists in the project. The pop up can have an additional statement saying that the project's main scene can always be edited from the project settings in the future. The user will now know that they can change the main scene anytime. The pop up will solve the issue of a new user having to search for "Project Settings" and the main_scene setting.

data.title: Inconsistent scene switching behavior between X11(Linux) and Android
data.body:
I tried to reduce this issue down to a testcase located here:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/0taiy1hu73l4pou/SceneSwitchBug.zip?dl=1

And this was tested with the most recent committ in github https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/commit/6b106b319b0b4c9436a992bf26c88d93180905e9

**On Linux:**
I have a button that shows/hides a panel.
Clicking on the showing panel hides it (via _input_event(event)).
I set _set_process_unhandled_input(true) so that it either the hides a showing panel or moves on to scene_b.

And that seems to work for me.

**On Android:**
If I click anywhere on the screen to trigger _unhandled_input(event), it switches to scene_b (as expected) but the StreamPlayer does not play. And the following shows up in the logcat.

> 01-06 17:31:16.812: I/godot(3614): [1;31;40mERROR: free: [1;37;40mMethod/Function Failed.
> 01-06 17:31:16.812: I/godot(3614): [0;31;40m   At: servers/visual/visual_server_raster.cpp:4173.[0;0;37m
> 01-06 17:31:16.812: I/godot(3614): [1;31;40mERROR: free: [1;37;40mMethod/Function Failed.
> 01-06 17:31:16.812: I/godot(3614): [0;31;40m   At: servers/visual/visual_server_raster.cpp:4173.[0;0;37m

When I press the green "pop-up" button, instead of showing the panel, it switches to scene_b and starts playing the music. And the following shows up in the logcat.

> 01-06 17:33:05.812: I/godot(3863): [1;31;40mERROR: free: [1;37;40mMethod/Function Failed.
> 01-06 17:33:05.812: I/godot(3863): [0;31;40m   At: servers/visual/visual_server_raster.cpp:4173.[0;0;37m

data.title: print() misses space between args
data.body:
In Python, print("x", "y") prints "x y", but in Godot it prints "xy".

Since, if you wanted the latter, you could just use print("x" + "y") or print(str("x", "y")), I think you should revert to the Python standard behaviour. Just different for no good reason.

data.title: Implement string interpolation
data.body:
Python supports interpolation, via printf (%) and string.format() - Horrid to use stuff like "fish" + str(my_int) + "frog")

Either option would be fine, but I'd recommend taking a leaf out of Boo, which uses direct interpolation: "fish $(my_int) frog" (which is also similar to how Ruby does it too).

data.title: SurfaceTool generated mesh has no vertices
data.body:
Related to #457 (which should probably be closed, since it runs without error for me).

Running the code from issue #457, (on linux release) IF I CHANGE IT SO THE VERTICES ARE ADDED LAST, mesh.get_surface_count() == 1 (as expected) and datatool.get_vertex_count() == 0 (where it should be 3!).

datatool.get_vertex(0) == Vector3(0, 0, 0) # This should be something else in the example.
datatool.get_vertex(99) == Vector3(0, 0, 0) # This should raise an error.
datatool.set_vertex(99, Vector3(1, 1, 1)) # This should raise an error.

Can't seem to see the mesh either. Saving the mesh resource doesn't have any data in other than the aabb (not sure if the data should be in there, but I'm needing to generate complex mesh geometry and load it again).

Trying more complex surface generation using a similar technique also creates no vertices in the mesh.

data.title: Some polishes to editor UI
data.body:
Before, when you opened the dialog to import a project it would display "Invalid Project" before anything was entered. The project manager shouldn't display this error message when the project path is empty. That, and the red error text displaying when you haven't entered a path may be distracting/confusing for people getting started.

And I added a solution described by #966 to prompt the save dialog if you run a scene that has not been saved before. It will prompt the save as dialog, and then run the scene after.

Fixed issue #1128 as well regarding "process being debugged has exited" alert.

data.title: PROCESS BEING DEBUGGED HAS EXITED
data.body:
PLEASE FIX THIS, REDUZ
/nag

data.title: Error log about creating editor_settings.xml when editor starts for the first time
data.body:
Running godot_x11-1.0stable.32 for first time crates ~/.godot/plugins, ~/.godot/templates and ~/.godot/tmp are created during startup but does not create ~/.godot/editor_settings.xml then complains with error messages:

> ERROR: create: Config file does not exist, creating.
>   At: tools/editor/editor settings.cpp:234.
> Error: scan_plugins: Plugin dir does not exist!
>   At: tools/editor/editor_settings.cpp:319.

Observed with godot_x11-1.0stable.32 on Xubuntu 14.04 on Celeron M and Radeon Xpress 200M.
Also observed with godot_x11-1.0stable.64 on Xubuntu 14.10 on core i5.

data.title: Path2D.Curve2D.interpolatef() broken and not linear
data.body:
Hi,

The Curve2D::interpolatef() methods was broken.

It was fixed with : #1124 

However, the interpolation seems not to be linear in time (it starts moving slowly, then faster near each the end of each segments).

~~Here is a tiny test case : https://github.com/UsernameIsAReservedWord/godot-test08-path2d~~

data.title: Select Gridmap or Tilemap Tiles
data.body: Hey, there. So, I think it'd be really helpful to be able to select and manipulate tiles in Tilemaps or Gridmaps. Currently, you have to manually replace any tiles that you want to alter. Having a method to select multiple of them to be able to rotate, delete, move, or even replace all of a specific kind of tile with another one would be really nice.

data.title: fixes CurveXD::interpolatef()
data.body:
Fixes 

```
Curve2D::interpolatef()
```

and

```
Curve3D::interpolatef()
```

methods.

data.title: F5 in file dialog refreshes AND runs
data.body: F5 is used both to start playing a scene and to refresh files in a file dialog. When F5 is pressed in a file dialog, it should not also be used to start playing the scene.

data.title: Cannot use constant variable of other class as contant value of current class
data.body:
``` python
class OtherClass:
    const CONSTANT_VARIABLE = 0

const TEST = OtherClass.CONSTANT_VARIABLE
# error: expected constant expression
```

data.title: GUI Import - 3D Mesh: check the save path before import
data.body: It would be nice if Godot checked if the save path is correct before importing the obj mesh.  I just had an issue importing a 40,000 point mesh, having it tell me at the end of import that it didn't know where to save.

data.title: Freshly compiled Godot scales funny on OS X 10.10
data.body:
On a retina MacBook Pro with I just compiled Godot, commit 8c4dd8de3919b789eac1a0f030563008bdcd44f5 and started directly the resulting godot.osx.tools.32.
The scaling is a bit funny. It scales the same way in the started game.
Environment:
- OS X 10.10
- XCode 6.1.1
- Scons 2.3.4
- g++:
  Configured with: --prefix=/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/usr --with-gxx-include-dir=/usr/include/c++/4.2.1
  Apple LLVM version 6.0 (clang-600.0.56) (based on LLVM 3.5svn)
  Target: x86_64-apple-darwin14.0.0
  Thread model: posix

See attached screenshot.
![bildschirmfoto 2015-01-05 um 01 48 58](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1672238/5608253/d77c8628-947d-11e4-9f33-a5d74223632e.png)
